Whether you’re covering up a bad hair day or protecting chilly ears, a beanie hat is the ultimate cold-weather companion. Functional and super stylish, the versatile accessory can be teamed with tailoring, sportswear, and everything in-between—making it just as important as your winter coat, scarf, or gloves. And guess what? The best beanies for men come in many different forms. From ribbed styles to cuffed classics, you’ll find a plethora of options ready to keep your head cozy. There’s also versions you can wear in the summer too. The only issue is finding the time to separate the good from the bad. To help, I’ve done all the hard work. Keep reading for my round-up of the finest beanies money can buy, plus some handy advice on how to wear them. Key Takeaways While the trusty baseball cap is your summer go-to, the best beanies for men are the perfect winter accessory. Which is why I’ve been on a quest to discover the styles every guy should own. I’ve pored over dozens upon dozens of sites and reviews, you’re welcome. Focusing on design, price, fabric, and colors, here I’ve presented a selection of seriously slick options that’ll keep your ears toasty and your head happy during the cold snap (and warmer weather too). You’ll find options for every budget, including Foret’s ribbed version and a budget-friendly beauty from H&M. In This ArticleOur PicksBuying ConsiderationsWhy You Should Trust Us Final VerdictFAQs erik.forsgren / Instagram Best Overall: Foret Relaxed Rib Beanie Why it’s great: If there was an MVP award for beanies, this ribbed version from Foret would be lifting The Michael Jordan Trophy. The ultimate all-rounder, it’s made from recycled wool that’ll keep you toasty without feeling too heavy and restricting. It’s versatile, affordable, and timelessly stylish. How to wear it: The beauty of this beanie is that it can be styled pretty much however you want. Wear it with a wool overcoat, turtleneck, pants, and Derby shoes for the kind of outfit you’d wear on a first date. Or keep it super casual with a hoodie, sweatpants, and sneakers. Flaws but not dealbreakers: While it’s a one-size-fits-all style, it does run slightly on the smaller side. If you’re the owner of an extra large head, you may find it a little tight. Material: 50% Recycled Wool, 30% Wool, 20% Recycled Polyamide | Colors: 6 | Care: Hand Wash Best Black Beanie: Closed Pure Wool Sailor Beanie Why it’s great: A fail-safe option that keeps it simple yet stylish, Closed’s black beanie is worth serious consideration. It’s made from wool that’s beautifully soft yet perfectly structured. How to wear it: You’ll find it particularly useful for your casual fits—especially those that are lacking accessories. Pop it on with a sweater and black khakis (rolled up), completing the outfit with boots and a loose-fitting bomber jacket. Flaws but not dealbreakers: It’s not chunky but it certainly carries more weight than some of its finer counterparts. Because of this, the beanie feels more at home with casual wear more than it does with formal garments. Material: 100% Wool | Colors: 2 | Care: Hand Wash Cold Best Knitted Beanie: Myrqvist Merino Wool Beanie Why it’s great: As classic as they come, Myrqvist’s knitted beanie will be one of the wisest investments you’ll make this winter. The wool and cashmere-blend fabric gives it a luxury feel that’s cozy without feeling heavy. Merino wool and Cashmere is a unique blend that while soft has a performance edge to it that’s great at maintaining heat and soaking up any sweat. While the ribbed design provides a timeless feel that can be easily dressed up or down. How to wear it: There doesn’t need to be too much planning when it comes to creating outfits with this beanie. You can use it to give your formalwear a relaxed edge or pair it with casual fits for a touch of refinement. Flaws but not dealbreakers: It’s not the cheapest option on this list nor is it the most expensive. If you’re working with a flexible budget, it’s definitely worth the splurge. Material: 90% Merino Wool, 10% Cashmere | Colors: 4 | Care: Hand Wash Cold Best Everyday: Axel Arigato Wool Beanie Why it’s great: It’s hard to go wrong with a gray beanie, especially when it’s made from wool and features a fold-over cuff. A stylish addition to your everyday rotation, this one from Axel Arigato fits snuggly around any shaped head and will keep your ears protected on chilly days. How to wear it: The world is your oyster. For ultimate coziness, you can pair it with a hoodie, sweatpants, and sneakers, or you can opt for something slightly smarter such as an overshirt, plain tee, jeans, and boots. Due to the cotton/wool blend, this is also a great shoulder season option if you’re looking for a beanie to carry you through to slightly warmer weather. Flaws but not dealbreakers: This beanie is available in two colors, both are unisex. That’s bad news if you’ve got a girlfriend that likes to share. Material: Wool/Cotton | Colors: 2 | Care: Hand Wash Cold Best Winter Beanie: Tropicfeel Bergen Beanie Why it’s great: Designed with an adjustable cuff and made from a blend of ethically sourced wool and recycled polyester, this ribbed beanie will keep you warm whether you’re exploring nature or commuting to the office. How to wear it: Tropicfeel is all about those outdoor essentials, so you’ll probably find yourself wearing it with a raincoat, sweater, combats, and hiking boots. When you’re not climbing mountains though, try it with a hoodie, jeans, and sneakers. Flaws but not dealbreakers: It’s finished with a subtle branded tab which slightly ruins it for those who are fans of minimalistic style. The wool blend is also going to be a little less warm than its pure wool counterparts, if warmth is the ultimate goal there are better options on the list. Material: 60% Wool, 40% Polyester | Colors: 1 | Care: Hand Wash Best Luxury Beanie: Luca Faloni Chunky Cashmere Beanie Why it’s great: At first, it’s easy to mistake this beanie for just another winter hat. But once you see it up close, you really start to appreciate the luxury. It’s made with 100% four-ply cashmere using gauge seven, giving it a slightly mesh-like look that’s light and beautifully soft. How to wear it: It’s the perfect accessory for your smarter ensembles (think turtleneck sweaters and slim-fitting pants) but can look just as good with a bomber jacket, crew neck tee, jeans, and sneakers. Just don’t forget to fold up the cuff. Flaws but not dealbreakers: Because of the cashmere construction, Luca Faloni’s beanie doesn’t feel as snug as some of the thicker wool versions I’ve suggested. Cashmere is also a harder fabric to care for, if you plan on putting this through the ringer I’d suggest going with a merino wool option. Material: 100% Cashmere | Colors: 4 | Care: Hand Wash Cold Best Cashmere Beanie: Aurelien Cashmere Beanie Why it’s great: Imagine your favorite cashmere sweater, but designed for your head. That’s probably the best way to describe this luxury beanie from Aurelien. You’ll want to wear it whenever you step outside, and thankfully it’s versatile enough to do just that. How to wear it: Ideal for refined downtime looks, try pairing yours with a fine knit jumper, slim-fitting pants, and Chelsea boots. For extra cold days, I suggest adding a wool overcoat and a cashmere scarf. Flaws but not dealbreakers: Cashmere doesn’t come cheap and nor does this beanie. If you’re trying to keep your outgoings low, you’ll probably need to give this one a miss. Material: 100% Cashmere | Colors: 13 | Care: Hand Wash Cold Best Colorful Beanie: Corridor Mohair Beanie Why it’s great: The importance of beanies to a well-rounded wardrobe is no secret, which means you may struggle to stand out from the crowd unless you start thinking outside of the box. Corridor’s mohair hat gives you that subtle point of difference without going overboard. It’s a must-have for your cold-weather fits and is definitely one of the best beanies for men. How to wear it: Use it to add some color to your everyday outfits, whether you opt for a casual shirt and jeans or sweats and a long-sleeved tee. Flaws but not dealbreakers: I’m all about the eye-catching colors, but you may like your style a little more reserved. If so, you’ll probably feel more comfortable with one of the plainer designs on this list. Material: 30% Mohair, 38% Acrylic, 32% Polyamide | Colors: 3 | Care: Hand Wash Best Budget: H&M Rib Knit Beanie Why it’s great: Apart from the price, what I love most about this beanie is its ability to add that perfect finishing touch to your ensembles. Featuring a rib-knit design with a fold-over cuff, it’ll look just as good on bald heads as it would if you’re the owner of a curly mane. How to wear it: There are multiple ways you can wear it and you can rock it for just about any occasion. You’ll find me showing it off at the weekend with a crew neck sweater, dad jeans, and high-top Chucks. If it’s cold enough, a knee-length coat will complete the fit. Flaws but not dealbreakers: If you’re the kind of guy who appreciates the finest fabrics, you may be disappointed. Having said that, it feels anything but cheap. Material: 53% Polyester, 47% Acrylic | Colors: 2 | Care: Machine Wash Cold Best On Amazon: Carhartt Knit Cuffed Beanie Why it’s great: Carhartt have been in the business of keeping heads warm since 1987, so I have no doubt they know what they’re doing. As durable as it is stylish, this cuffed beanie wraps around your noggin like a hug on a dreary day. You can wear it on the weekend, but it’ll also make quite the impression if you’re working outside. How to wear it: This is an option for more casual outfits, as well as a trusty companion for your work gear. Keep it super chill with a hoodie and sweatpants, or wear it during off-duty days with a flannel shirt, graphic tee, and boots. Flaws but not dealbreakers: The fold-over cuff can overwhelm particularly small heads. But I’ll have to let you determine the size of your skull. Material: 100% Acrylic | Colors: 10+ | Care: Hand Wash Best Summer Beanie: UNDERCONTROL Aerocool Beanie Why it’s great: Unlike the traditional beanie hat that’s designed for combating the cold, this version can be worn regardless of the season. Thanks to a clover-shaped circular cross-section, space is created between the fibers allowing for your head to breathe and not get too hot. How to wear it: Suitable for weekend events and days in the office, I suggest an Oxford shirt, plain tee, khakis, and high-top sneakers. Flaws but not dealbreakers: Smaller than your average beanie, this cropped style isn’t going to be everyone’s cup of tea. Heck, you may just not want to wear a beanie during the summer months (and that’s totally fine). Material: 100% Poly | Colors: 9 | Care: Hand Wash Cold Best Beanie for Bald Men: Everlane Chunky Beanie Why it’s great: Bald heads are more vulnerable to cold weather and itchy fabrics, which is why Everlane’s soft and cozy beanie is a must-have. It’s made from cotton in an extra-thick knit that has enough stretch to cater for big and small domes alike. The branded tag gives it a subtle point of difference. How to wear it: Adjust the cuffed brim until you’re happy with the fit and throw it on with your favorite smart-casual pieces. I’d wear it at the weekend with a zip-up hoodie, T-shirt, jeans, and high-top sneakers. Flaws but not dealbreakers: This particular style sells quite fast, so you’ll have to be quick if you want to secure one in time for winter. Material: 97% Organic Cotton, 1% Elastane, 2% Other Fiber | Colors: 3 | Care: Hand Wash Cold lambojimmy / Instagram Buying Considerations for Best Beanies for Men Material The material of your beanie is crucial for both comfort and functionality. The best beanie hats come in a range of materials such as wool, cotton, and acrylic—plus other blends that include mixtures of various fabrics. To make sure you’re choosing the right material, it’s important to consider the weather and time of the year you’ll be wearing the hat. Wool is excellent for colder climates as it provides warmth and insulation, while cotton is more suitable for milder conditions. You should also look for hats with soft and non-itchy materials on the inside to ensure comfort, especially if you have sensitive skin. Style Beanie hats come in different styles, including slouchy, cuffed, and fitted. Choose a style that matches your personal preference and complements your face shape. When trying on a beanie, make sure it covers your ears comfortably and doesn’t feel too tight or loose. Ideally, it should be snug without feeling constricting. Keep in mind that different brands might have slightly different sizing, so it’s a good idea to consult size charts first. Color The color of the beanie hat can significantly impact its versatility and how well it matches your wardrobe. Neutral colors like black, gray, navy, and brown tend to be more versatile and can easily complement various outfits. If you’re looking to make a statement, you might want to opt for a brighter color or patterned design. Consider your existing wardrobe and the outfits you intend to wear with the beanie. Why You Should Trust Us As a writer for FashionBeans, I’m always on the lookout for anything that will give you a little more pizazz in your style. I’m also a sucker for a good hat. From caps to fedoras and snapbacks, I own just about every style you can think of. But it’s not just my experience in hat-wearing that has allowed me to come up with a list of the best beanies of men. I’ve also had a little help from hundreds of reviewers and a list of go-to brands from Luca Faloni to Everlane and Closed. ethantglenn / Instagram Final Verdict Finding the best beanies for men is about more than just staying warm; it’s the icing on the cake, allowing you to add a touch of personal style to your outfit. Whether you’re going for a classic ribbed design, a mini urban look, or a luxury cashmere addition, the world of beanies offers endless options to suit your taste and the occasion. If you’re not quite sure which one to pick, Foret’s timeless wool version is a great place to start. Warm, timeless, and versatile, it’s an excellent addition to any cold-weather wardrobe. You can style it pretty much however you like and it’s sure to be your go-to for many seasons to come. FAQ Absolutely. Beanies are a versatile and popular accessory that are perfect for guys. Not only are they great for keeping warm during colder seasons, but they can also add a stylish touch to smart-casual outfits. The best type of beanie depends on your personal style, the weather, and how you plan to wear it. For example, a classic ribbed beanie is an excellent all-rounder, while a thick wool beanie is great for winter. During the summer months, you’ll require something lighter such as a mini fisherman beanie. To look good in a beanie, you should start by choosing the right fit. By ensuring your beanie fits your head comfortably, you’ll feel more confident and look it too. Once you get this right, you’ll need to coordinate it with your outfits and make sure you’re dressing for the occasion. Buying Considerations for Best Beanies for Men

Material

The material of your beanie is crucial for both comfort and functionality. The best beanie hats come in a range of materials such as wool, cotton, and acrylic—plus other blends that include mixtures of various fabrics.

To make sure you’re choosing the right material, it’s important to consider the weather and time of the year you’ll be wearing the hat. Wool is excellent for colder climates as it provides warmth and insulation, while cotton is more suitable for milder conditions. You should also look for hats with soft and non-itchy materials on the inside to ensure comfort, especially if you have sensitive skin.

Style

Beanie hats come in different styles, including slouchy, cuffed, and fitted. Choose a style that matches your personal preference and complements your face shape. When trying on a beanie, make sure it covers your ears comfortably and doesn’t feel too tight or loose. Ideally, it should be snug without feeling constricting. Keep in mind that different brands might have slightly different sizing, so it’s a good idea to consult size charts first.

Color

The color of the beanie hat can significantly impact its versatility and how well it matches your wardrobe. Neutral colors like black, gray, navy, and brown tend to be more versatile and can easily complement various outfits. If you’re looking to make a statement, you might want to opt for a brighter color or patterned design. Consider your existing wardrobe and the outfits you intend to wear with the beanie.
